item.title: [150] Nintendo Switch 2 Will Cost $540 After Tariffs
item.description:
>Top analyst firm DFC Intelligence has issued its first Switch 2 report in the wake of its pricing, and while it‚Äôs mostly positive about the console‚Äôs prospects, the tariffs are the less-than-good-news part of it.

>While DFC says it believes the $450 price is still a good value, and it was less than the $500 they predicted before the pre-tariff global economic conditions, the tariffs now complicate things.

>They believe it will lower the overall sales of the Switch 2. Because of pricing concerns, their estimates for 2025 are now 15 million, down from 17 million. Those pricing concerns? They say it‚Äôs possible there could be a 20% increase in the price of the Switch 2 over the next two years if these tariffs are maintained. That would put it at $540 in the US. Of course, there is easily the possibility, if not likelihood, PlayStation, Xbox and PC gaming prices could go up for the same tariff-based reasons. DFC says they will continue evolving their forecasts as things change on the ground.
https://www.forbes.com/sites/paultassi/2025/04/08/analysts-predict-potential-eventual-530-switch-2-price-after-tariffs/

Original filename: Nintendo Switch 2.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 35] Texan scientists un-extinct the dire wolf species
item.description:
While California is bickering about fringe minority issues, the Great Men in Texas just un-extincted an entire species. Un-extincted is expected to be added to dictionaries everywhere after this pivotal achievement
They used the DNA found in a species known as Dire Wolf that went extinct 10,000 years ago, and made 20 precise edits to it using DNA from its closing living relative, and then grew them in a surrogate mother.
They were born October 1 2024 and are currently alive and healthy.
https://www.ibtimes.co.uk/meet-dire-wolf-trio-remus-romulus-khaleesi-how-texas-lab-revived-extinct-species-1732511
Meet The Dire Wolf Trio Remus, Romulus And Khaleesi: How A Texas Lab Revived An Extinct Species

It was once thought to be a creature of fantasy, made famous by Game of Thrones, but now the legendary dire wolf has returned‚Äîsort of. Scientists at Texas-based biotech company Colossal Biosciences claim to have successfully revived the extinct predator through cutting-edge gene editing, producing three live wolf pups that carry dire wolf DNA for the first time in over 12,000 years.

The landmark achievement marks the world's first successful instance of de-extinction, according to The New York Times. Although the animals are not exact replicas of the ancient species, they carry 20 key dire wolf genes, including those influencing size, coat colour, and build.

Two males named Romulus and Remus were born in October 2024, and three months later, a female named Khaleesi. All three now live in a secure, 2,000-acre preserve somewhere in the northern United States. The wolves are already showing telltale traits: white, dense fur, large bodies, bushy tails and thick manes. According to Colossal's chief scientific officer, Beth Shapiro, the animals represent the closest humans have come to bringing an extinct species back to life.

Original filename: üê∫ Romulus & Remus üê∫.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 30] Is there any dish you try and fail to cook?
item.description:
For me, it's Beef Stroganoff. 5+ attempts, mediocre results at best. It feels like a boring beef + mushroom stew that's covered with heavy cream for taste every time, the dish just doesn't come together.

Original filename: Beef-Stroganoff-6.jpg

item.title: [ 30] Why do you cook?
item.description:
The world now has everything ready and better made. Why would you cook something out of inferior ingredients?

Industry has:
>Resources
>Time
>Specialized equipment
>Expert knowledge

So, unless you are trying to seem like you have some sort of social status, why would you spend time trying to recreate products that the industry has already perfected? Food is a product, and inferior products should receive no special status.

Original filename: 8y.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [282] /iemg/ & /pmpg/ - In-Ear Monitor & Portable Music Player General
item.description:
How to request advice:
>Budget
>Intended use (media, source, environment)
>Frequency response preference and music examples
>Past gear and your thoughts on them

FAQ:
>Where do I buy IEMs?
Amazon, Aliexpress, Linsoul, Hifigo, Shenzhenaudio

>Shopping Guide (IEMs, Cables, Ear Tips, etc.):
https://rentry.org/consoomer_guide

>EQ Guide (Measurements, Targets, Equalizer, etc.):
https://4ciemg.github.io/IEM-EQ-Guide/

>/iemg/'s Blog/Wiki:
https://4ciemg.github.io/IEMGazette/

>Frequency Response Graph Tool
squig.link

>Budget Wire Over-Ear IEMs:
‚Ä¢ Tanchjim Bunny (Mild U) - $20
‚Ä¢ Truthear Gate (Neutral) - $23
‚Ä¢ EPZ Q1 Pro / G10 (V-shape) - $35
‚Ä¢ Kiwi Ears Cadenza (Warm Neutral) - $35

>Bullet IEMs:
‚Ä¢ Tanchjim ONE DSP (Neutral) - $28
‚Ä¢ Etymotic ER2XR (Neutral) - $140

>Flathead Earbuds:
‚Ä¢ Blue Vido (Warm) - $5
‚Ä¢ Faaeal Iris 2.0 (Warm) - $10

>USB-C DACs:
‚Ä¢ JCALLY JM20 - $24
‚Ä¢ Tanchjim Stargate II (8-Band PEQ) - $38
‚Ä¢ Fosi Audio DS2 2024 (CS43131) - $45
‚Ä¢ Qudelix 5K (20-Band PEQ/GEQ) - $110

>PMPs:
‚Ä¢ HiBy R1 - $85
‚Ä¢ Hifi Walker H2 / Surfans F20 (Rockbox) - $120
‚Ä¢ HiBy M300 - $200
‚Ä¢ Hidizs AP80 Pro-X - $200

>AVOID USING:
‚Ä¢ Mainboard audio when using multi-driver pos

item.title: [120] Working on my Pok√©mon Fangame where almost everything is a submission, replaci
item.description:
Working on my Pok√©mon Fangame where almost everything is a submission, replacing vanilla types, mons, abilities, moves etc.

Took a bit to make a new thread, as I was catching up on implementing mons, abilities and moves

Main Doc: https://scrawny-crustacean-f0d.notion.site/Unnamed-Pkmn-Game-1b5b9ecf5b6e80d5889dda00b4bf40e7

Typechart: https://files.catbox.moe/7ii2eb.png

Pokemon Doc: https://scrawny-crustacean-f0d.notion.site/1bab9ecf5b6e80bcbb9fd4c2994a4c4a?v=1bab9ecf5b6e802b8b92000c0d380208

Moves Doc: https://scrawny-crustacean-f0d.notion.site/1b5b9ecf5b6e8035baaae94d16ef813c?v=1b5b9ecf5b6e80b3b9ae000c5e27a560

Abilities Doc: https://scrawny-crustacean-f0d.notion.site/1b5b9ecf5b6e80cca0f9c5ce94ef9049?v=1b5b9ecf5b6e80998e35000cd4cddfd0

Currently open for submissions for:
- Type chart effectiveness changes
- Moves
- Abilities
- Items
- Sprites/Backsprites for mons/items without Sprites (See docs)
- Menu Sprites (128x64)
- Pok√©mon
- Name for the Project

Most of the submission options don't have a template since they're rather simple so don't need one, only Pok√©mon submissions:

>Name*:
>Type(s)*:
>Stats*:
>Move(s)*:
>Abilitiy/ies*:
>Growth Rate*:
>BaseXP:
>EVs:
>Catch Rate:
>Base Happiness:
>Height:
>Weight:
>Egg Group(s):
>Hatch Steps:
>Category+Pokedex*:
>Front Sprite*:
>Backsprite:
>Shiny:
>Wild held Item(s):
>Cry:
>Evolves To/Method:
>Evolves from:
*Required
Send links to sprites

Addionally open for discussions on:
- Project Name
- Important Earlygame Trainers

If you're interested in contributing but don't have any original ideas, you can also fill in requests, listed here:
https://scrawny-crustacean-f0d.notion.site/1c9b9ecf5b6e8089894ae49d5ef6dc23?v=1c9b9ecf5b6e8077b452000cede46188

These were mentioned previously in the request tab, but looking for starter evos as they are round-robin:
https://files.catbox.moe/od67sa.png

Previous thread: >>57622967

Original filename: Pokedex.png
